pkgmetadata.longdescription: Simultaneous Non-Gaussian Component Analysis // Implementation of SING algorithm to extract joint and individual non-Gaussian components from two datasets. SING uses an objective function that maximizes the skewness and kurtosis of latent components with a penalty to enhance the similarity between subject scores. Unlike other existing methods, SING does not use PCA for dimension reduction, but rather uses non-Gaussianity, which can improve feature extraction. Benjamin B.Risk, Irina Gaynanova (2021) doi:10.1214/21-AOAS1466.
